intro: Mesosphaerum polyanthum, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has lance-shaped leaves. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens. Mesosphaerum polyanthum prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sun exposure.
